arquivos package

Submodules

arquivos.ref module

arquivos.ref.spc(arquivo, analitos)[código fonte]

Placeholder function for importing files in ‘.spc’ format.

Parâmetros:

  • arquivo (str) – File to be imported.

  • analitos (list) – List of analytes.

arquivos.ref.txt(file_name, **kwargs)[código fonte]

Imports a .txt file into a pandas DataFrame formatted for analytes.

If analytes are not specified, the program considers the first line as analytes. To specify analytes, use the ‘analitos’ argument.

Parâmetros:

  • file_name (str) – Name of the file located in the ‘dados’ folder.

  • **kwargs –

    Optional arguments: - analitos (list/tuple/set, optional): Object containing analytes.

Retorna:

DataFrame with samples as rows and analytes as columns.

Tipo de retorno:

pandas.DataFrame

Levanta:

  • ValueError – If the number of specified analytes doesn’t match the number of columns in the file.

  • FileNotFoundError – If the file is not found in the ‘dados’ folder.

arquivos.ref.xlsx(file_name, **kwargs)[código fonte]

Imports an .xlsx file into a pandas DataFrame formatted for analytes.

If analytes are not specified, the program considers the first line as analytes. To specify analytes, use the ‘analitos’ argument.

Parâmetros:

  • file_name (str) – Name of the Excel file located in the ‘dados’ folder.

  • **kwargs –

    Optional named arguments: - aba (str or int, default=0): Sheet name or index to be read. - analitos (list/tuple/set, optional): Object containing analytes.

Retorna:

DataFrame with samples as rows and analytes as columns.

Tipo de retorno:

pandas.DataFrame

Levanta:

  • FileNotFoundError – If the file is not found in the ‘dados’ folder.

  • ValueError – If the number of analytes doesn’t match the number of columns in the sheet.

arquivos.spec module

arquivos.spec.spc(arquivo, comprimentos)[código fonte]

Placeholder function for importing files in ‘.spc’ format.

Parâmetros:

  • arquivo (str) – File to be imported.

  • comprimentos (list) – List of wavelengths.

arquivos.spec.txt(file_name, **kwargs)[código fonte]

Imports a .txt file into a pandas DataFrame formatted for spectra.

If wavelengths are not specified, the program considers the first line as wavelengths. To specify wavelengths, use the ‘comprimentos’ argument.

Parâmetros:

  • file_name (str) – Name of the file located in the ‘dados’ folder.

  • **kwargs –

    Optional named arguments: - comprimentos (list/tuple/set, optional): Object containing wavelengths. If not specified, uses the first line.

Retorna:

DataFrame with samples as rows and wavelengths as columns.

Tipo de retorno:

pandas.DataFrame

Levanta:

  • ValueError – If the number of specified wavelengths doesn’t match the number of columns in the file.

  • FileNotFoundError – If the file is not found in the ‘dados’ folder.

arquivos.spec.xlsx(file_name, **kwargs)[código fonte]

Imports an .xlsx file into a pandas DataFrame formatted for spectra.

If wavelengths are not specified, the program considers the first line as wavelengths. To specify wavelengths, use the ‘comprimentos’ argument.

Parâmetros:

  • file_name (str) – Name of the Excel file located in the ‘dados’ folder.

  • **kwargs –

    Optional named arguments: - aba (str or int, default=0): Sheet name or index to be read. - comprimentos (list/tuple/set, optional): Object containing wavelengths. If not specified, uses the first line.

Retorna:

DataFrame with samples as rows and wavelengths as columns.

Tipo de retorno:

pandas.DataFrame

Levanta:

  • FileNotFoundError – If the file is not found in the ‘dados’ folder.

  • ValueError – If the number of wavelengths doesn’t match the number of columns in the sheet.
